The loop is closed. *Transforming the 2D Sketch into 3D* 1. Set the sketch scaling parameter to 0.75. 2. Part 2: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Top Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles [-90, 0, -90] and a translation vector [0.75, 0, 0.1258]. *Sketching the 2D Layout* 1. Create a new face (face_1) for the sketch. 2. Draw the first line (line_1) with a start point at [0.0, 0.0] and an end point at [0.4962, 0.6242]. 3. Draw the second line (line_2) with a start point at [0.4962, 0.6242] and an end point at [0.0, 0.6242]. 4. Draw the third line (line_3) with a start point at [0.0, 0.6242] and an end point at [0.0, 0.0]. The loop is closed. *Transforming the 2D Sketch into 3D* 1. Set the sketch scaling parameter to 0.6242. 2. Apply transformation using the Euler angles [0, 0, 0] degrees and translation vector [0, 0, 0] to the 2D sketch plane. 3. Perform a cut operation by extruding the 2D sketch along the opposite normal direction by a distance of 0.6 units. Please note that the final shape will be the combination of part_1 and part_2, and the dimensions are derived from the provided JSON data. The description for the final shape has been omitted as the main goal is to provide instructions on generating the parametric CAD model based on the JSON data.</description>
